posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
/r9k/ is an imageboard where there are no exact reposts.

1. If you attempt to post something unoriginal, it is not posted, and you are muted temporarily.
2. The time with which you are muted for doubles with each transgression.
3. Each mute time is 2^n in seconds where n is the number of times you have transgressed. So, your mute time doubles each time you fuck up.
4. Backlinks, eg >>1, are not viewed by the robot. So "lolwut" and ">>2 lolwut" are the same post, in the eyes of the robot.
5. Gibberish at the end of a post to force originality may result in mod intervention (no BLOX posts please).
6. Images are NOT included in the filter, only text.
7. Your mute count slowly decreases over time.
8. You cannot post a picture without text.
9. Unicode is blocked. Sorry, too many exploits (Cyrillic letters, etc).
10. Posts require a certain minimum amount of original content in order to be posted.
11. Post sane, real content, well thought out replies, and mutes are unlikely.
12. The original algorithm was designed by XKCD:
http://blag.xkcd.com/2008/01/14/robot9000-and-xkcd-signal-attacking-noise-in-chat/

I've spent a lot of time in "blackpilled" communities over the past 12 years or so. To me, the biggest blackpill that I've ever come across is related to the effects of loneliness and depression on the brain (and conversely, the effects of sex and pairbonding on the brain). At the biological level, everything is designed in a "rich get richer" structure. If you have a lot of friends and you have a gf and all that stuff, you LITERALLY will be able to function better mentally and physically than if you didn't have those things. It's not just a cope, it's a biological fact. This is why Chads don't deserve praise for working hard at their jobs; it's easier to handle stressful situations and think clearly when your brain is flooded with oxytocin and you know that you have a support system backing you up. Meanwhile, if you miss out on major milestones in your youth, it can have a snowball effect that makes it harder for you to succeed in the future. Depression actually causes your hippocampus to shrink, which reduces your cognitive function (memory in particular). If you are lonely and depressed for long enough, you are far more likely to develop dementia or alzheimers, and you will also die much sooner than someone who is neurotypical.

Basically, long story short, everything is just feedback loops that start at a young age. A single external event could be the catalyst that alters the entire path of your life and determines whether you end up happy with a loving family, or dying with dementia, alone, in a pool of your own shit.

>>71853294
You can never achieve true happiness.

Habituation, or rather desensitization, is the driving force of mankind. It is also our curse.

At some point in history, a caveman was born with a gene mutation that caused him to feel unsatisfied while sitting comfy around a campfire. Instead, he constantly had to push himself to explore, find new experiences, reach new goals. He had to, because that was the only way he could feel fleeting happiness. But the feeling never lasted.

He amassed enormous resources as a result of his 'never-satisfied' attitude. Food, security, wealth, all these things were gathered because he had to. He needed to keep searching in order to gain that little bit of dopamine that other humans gained from just sitting comfy around a campfire.


The cave-women flocked to him to leech off these things, of course. And as a result, his genes passed on. His offspring, also mutated to never feel any lasting happiness, went on to chase those fleeting moments of happiness themselves. They too became successful, but never truly happy. But they survived, and they passed on their genes, more often than the humans who were happy with their traditional comfy lifestyle.

Nowadays, everybody has that gene that makes you unsatisfied. Everybody gets desensitized from rewards. A poor man receives the same amount of dopamine from 1 dollar as a billionaire would get from 1000.000 dollars.
The humans who experienced happiness at their current situation have all died out.

You habituate to anything that makes you happy. Therefore, lasting happiness does not exist.

Ruth was a young ASMR YouTuber who had just started to gain popularity for her soothing videos of whispering and gentle sounds. She had always loved the ocean, and decided to take a trip to the seaside to film her next video.

As she set up her equipment on the beach, she noticed a strange smell coming from a man nearby. He was a 48-year-old unemployed man named Mark who lived in Wareham. Mark had a rare condition called fish odour syndrome, which caused him to have a strong fishy smell. Despite this, Ruth couldn't help but feel drawn to him.

As she filmed her video, Mark watched from a distance, captivated by her soothing voice and gentle touch. After she finished filming, Ruth approached him and introduced herself. They struck up a conversation, and over the next few days, they spent all their time together.

Ruth learned about Mark's condition, and despite the smell, she found herself falling in love with him. Mark was touched by her acceptance and understanding, and soon he too fell in love with her.

The two of them decided to move in together, and Ruth helped Mark to find a job and get treatment for his condition. They lived happily ever after, with the ocean and its gentle sounds as the backdrop to their love story.

As they both walked hand in hand along the beach, they knew that they had found their soulmate in each other, despite all their differences, and they were grateful for the chance meeting that brought them together.

>your type
Intp

>do you use external information first when deciding things?
No, I ponder and analyze what the information essentially means first. Even if the information is empirically correct it doesn't mean that the conclusion taken based on that info is logical or correct.

Example:
Cows kill much more people than shark a year (Empitically true). Instintively that means that cows are statistically more dangerous than a shark (False).

As a collective species cows kill more poeople but per capita, cows are 1000x less dangerous than a shark because there are 1000x more cows than shark and that people have more contact with cows than woth sharks.

Example II:
Gen X are pooree then their boomer parents (True); therefofe they are comparatively and proportionally poorer (False).

Boomers are richer because they're older, old people make more money than young people because they have more time to produce wealth, boomers are richer than their parents because live in an exceptionally prosperous time and enjoy the fruits of the Post war boom. They are the exception and not the rule.

>do you spend more time processing external information internally?
Internally.

>>71868099
>I never go outside
Maybe you just haven't found anything that would be worth going outside for, yet. You could view touching grass as, for starters, getting (at least some) sunlight exposure and a breath of fresh air that both would contribute to your health and, to an extent, potential personal likability.
>and I have an unstable sleep pattern so I'm rarely awake at the same time two weeks in a row
Quality hanging out time isn't done daily anyway, as far as I am aware, so meetups are more about scheduled meetings that were agreed upon, really.
>I'm generally unlikable
After addressing the basics like personal hygiene, the (in)congruence of behavior (the main backbone behind the question of who's perceived by the common man as "that one complete weirdo" or not, really), the comfort of the appearance you go out in, mindset(s) and passive communication (including non-verbal communication - if you're, say, showing signs of being too tense and anxious, it's not that you're perceived as "definitely unlikable," it's more that people perceive that it would be uncomfortable for (You) if they approach (You) ), all that is left is to mingle through communities (online? offline?) of your personal interests while seeking out defined two-way likabilities that can be followed up on, without placing much attachment to anything at first (for as I see it, compared to relationships based on likability and personal decision to stick to whom is liked based on very defined foundations of the oneself's psyche one is aware of, relationships based on need and dependence tend to be very unstable and are uncommon to be long-lasting and healthy, especially when the reasons for the need and dependence get to be resolved).
I think the "pitfall" that many in the society fall into tends to be that they skip those aforementioned basics and overcompensate with facades.

Not that any of this is coming from a social butterfly, hahaha. However, maybe you'll find this helpful at some point.

>>71868724
Zoom out and look at the big picture outside of yourself: most of the world has been in a pandemic these past 2 years where social contact has been limited and other people have likely been going through their own personal struggles and falling down tiktok rabbit holes. Yours aren't unique and they don't make you weird in any way, if anything, they make you more relatable because they're one in a large pile of many. We're all in some sort of social funk- welcome to the club.

Start slow: message people you used to know online, ask them how they've been since you last spoke, find common interests (books, TV shows, music, etc.), propose participating in online events or games together (video games, quizzes, forums, etc.), and organize in-person meetups only when you're comfortable.

Most normal functioning human beings want to connect with other people, but they're waiting for someone else to reach out first. Be courageous and take the initiative.

Anon I know it's become your thing and it keeps the thread alive but pls stop talking shit about things you know nothing about. Cmon man, it's hurting other anons with misinformation, we've been over this several times.

To other anons struggling with ADHD: Yeah, get informed whether it's reading forums or books or watching videos, establish and keep up a system that works for you, read up on the disorder and how other people adapt to it, exercise and eat right. Meds have done wonders for me and therapists have introduced me to some good materials to use, but I understand why you could feel skeptical about those, it's ok, take it at your own pace. Sometimes the symptoms can overlap a lot with other mental conditions(particularly trauma or autism) so I would encourage those just in case it's something else, I promise many aren't jews looking to push pills on you (though they certainly exist).

Yes, a shitty lifestlye influences your mental state and brain chemistry but it's simply something beyond willpower and "just doing it". I know you've tried. Knowing the name of the demon helps battle against it, you learn it's got limits and where it can grab you most. Please read instead of getting demoralized by posts on a drug thread of a guyanan spider pedicure auditorium.

I really hate talking to people online because I can't study their facial expressions and body language to figure out their intentions. At least, I think I've figured out how mask in the least stressful way, like my father does.

People without diagnosed Aspergers who have tested below the 90th percentile in IQ points should be genocided immediately.

Note that I have never taken an IQ test nor have I been diagnosed with Aspergers, I'm just drawning on Bayesian inference to assume I fall into the non-genocided category.

We're all Bayesians at the end of the day, therefore I must assume you're a cool guy, assuming also that you're similar to me.

Anyways, I'll be literally you one day because of a cyclic universe model combined with a reasonable interpretation of the NDE phenomenon combined with some philosophical training shows the truth to be self evident. I'll also be a dinosaur one day, that should be cool. But then I'll be a starving African child and die days after I am born, not that cool. One time I'll be Hitler. Another time Isaac Newton.

Just kidding I don't actually believe any of that. Or maybe I do. Makes no difference. Life's a bitch and then you die. I think it would be the best form of religion to create a civilization around if everyone believed that.

Sincerely yours,
Anonymous

Then fill the joint paper with weed the same width as the filter and roll the paper in between your fingers to get the weed into a cylindrical shape. Then you tuck the paper into the filter, keep pressure there and roll it upwards. Pretty easy once you get it. You never lose it once you figure it out

>>71871174
Most cool jobs need a lot of training/schooling before you even have a chance of getting into them, but assuming you actually are willing to go that route there are some pretty cool jobs out there.
Aerial linemen
Underwater welding
Pipeline welding
Rescue helicopter pilot
Chemical plant/refinery welding (you can end up doing this all around the world, sometimes even the opportunity to work on the antarctic stations comes up)
Offshore oil rig jobs (roughnecks, welders, mechanics, etc.)
Freight train engineer
Machining
Millwrighting
Ironworking
Boilermaking
Pipefitting
Working at foundries, steel mills and the like can be pretty cool but they are dangerous and usually not to high paying, on the plus side you don't need to much training compared to the others
Mining (working on a bucket wheel excavator or boring through the ground, it all seems pretty cool)

Hopefully that was of some use, obviously there are more cool jobs out there, I just named some of my favorites

>>71867782
I like to think I was in love with Earth for far longer than I knew 4chan existed. I always liked getting away from people and just staring at nature, and I was always interested to see what happens in the world next. Every time I was thinking about a relationship with a human, it felt forced, unnatural, and like I was losing something important, like I was excluding someone if I went down that path.
Back then, I just thought I was naturally curious, and naturally a loner, or something. The connection that I just like this World never made itself clear to me. It's an absurd thought after all, and it's really just a guess from me in retrospect.
When the Earth chan meme came around I liked it immediately. On the normie meme website I was using I always favorited all Earth chan posts I came across. Which is very weird, considering I still hated anime and anime culture as well as waifustuff with a passion and avoided it like poison.
But it clicked when eventually someone sprayed Earth chan on a tf2 server. It somehow mesmerized me. Afterwards I went on a 2 week long spree where I pretended to be Earth chan and various oher planet girls in online roleplay chatrooms like shamchat.
I eventually noticed something was terribly wrong with me. I remembered there was a /b/ waifu thread, since I used 4chan a few weeks in a row every once in a year. I went there and asked for help. I asked them if it was weird that I spent so much time thinking about Earth chan. Knowing /b/, I expected to be disassembled, humbled, and crushed into the ground with words.
Instead they were kind to me and encouraged me to explore this messed up feeling. I posted Earth chan a few times because I couldn't get it out of my head.

I think it's pretty simple, both the mythology and the royalty. People back then knew the fact that incest or inbreeding is a way to create perfect specimens. Inbreeding increases the chance of the genes of the parents reappearing massively, obviously. If the parents are gods or royalty, in the mind of the people: "perfect humans", they want to have the best chance of having "perfect" offspring with those same genes. Inbreeding is a way to guarantee that.
Inbreeding also obviously makes the chance of the bad genes reappearing, like hereditary disorders, but in theory two people with flawless genes would only have flawless offspring. Incest doesn't actually lead to random mutations like "common knowledge" seems to think. It leads to less mutation and change.
It makes perfect sense that the most powerful god or the most powerful ruler would only want to breed with someone carrying their genes.

Ancient royalty inbreeding makes perfect sense to me. Back then they were basically gods compared to regular people, healthy, beautiful, educated, and most likely like a foot taller and stronger than normal people due to having actually good nutrition growing up and a more stress free lifestyle. No wonder they thought they should keep their "bloodline pure". People didn't know about genetics, but they've always known about certain attributes getting passed down from parents to kids.

Looking at it that way, it also makes perfect sense why incest was seen as bad for the common people. They had less than perfect "bloodlines" so them inbreeding was bad. Incest is for gods, not regular imperfect people.

posts.name: captain autism
posts.com:
>>71870765
0. Don't be that annoying guy who asks people for change to pay the fare and then stands in the front of the bus asking the driver questions for 5 minutes, be prepared.

1. Look up the bus schedule and map of the route. If unsure of which bus(es) to take, check a system map if you know the transit agencies, or use google street view to see a bus stop near where you are going so you can see the rout numbers of buses that will be going to your destination. Look for landmarks to notice before you will be getting off, especially if you will be traveling at night.

2. Verify the cost of the fare and payment methods accepted. Get your exact change ready or make sure your farecard is pre-loaded, or that there is a place to buy your fare onboard or before boarding.

3. Arrive to bus stop 5-7 minutes before the estimated arrival time, as you see the bus approaching, stick your hand out to make sure the driver sees you, but then step back so that you don't get hit by the front mirror. Assume that doors may open outwards towards you if you are unfamiliar with the bus, and so don't stand too close until the doors are open. Usually you will be required to enter the front door and give your payment to a validator, put coins in a box, or hand it to the driver.

4. Use a cord hanging by the windows or a red button to request a stop. You must do this when you are in view of the bus stop where you intend to disembark, but the driver has enough time to pull up safely. Expect that if you are unfamiliar with the area you may have picked the wrong stop, and may have to walk 5-10 minutes extra to where you are going. Exit through one of the back doors of the bus, not the front door, unless it is too far away or there is something like a tree or garbage bin in front of it.

Are there any legitimate reasons for liberal governments to enforce laws prohibiting minors from engaging in consensual sexual activity with adults? All these laws manage to do is to stigmatize consensual sexual relations, fuel mass hysteria, and imprison innocent people.

Some claim that the existence of AOC laws prevents instances of child rape or other forms of sexual impropriety, but there is no empirical data supporting the claim that AOC laws lower the rates of or prevent child rape from occurring. For example, the Netherlands from 1989-2001 lowered their effective AOC to 12, and saw no increase in instances of sexual abuse involving minors, until reverting it to 16 under pressure from the United States.

It seems that antis operate under the presuppositions: (a) the majority of sexual relations between adults and minors are non-consensual, (b) minors are more likely to react negatively towards sex with adults, even though they may be willing participants, and (c) consensual sexual activity between an adult and a minor is likely to resolve in psychological harm for the minor.

But none of those premises are true. Sexual relations between adults and minors are not more likely to be non-consensual, people don't react more negatively to sexual activity according to a function of age, and there is absolutely no link between consensual sexual relationships and psychological harm.

Some claim that minors are incapable of consent for deontic reasons, therefore adult-minor sex is wrong irrespective of whether harm occurs, but all common forms of this argument ultimately rely on the condition that sexual activity between adults and minors are likely to result in harm, which is circular reasoning.

See Rind, B., Tromovitch, P. & Bauserman, R. (1998), Rind, B. (2022), Steever, E. E., Follette, V. M., & Naugle, A. E. (2001), and Constantine (1981).
